contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|-ka|Ka|kA|ka|ka-}} '''Ka''' or '''KA''' may refer to: {{TOC right}} ==Language== * [[Ka (Cyrillic)]] * [[Ka (kana)]] * [[Georgian language]], by ISO 639-1 code * ka, a glyph in the [[Brahmic family of scripts]] ==Media and entertainment== * [[Ka (Dark Tower)|Ka (''Dark Tower'')]], a plot element in Stephen King's ''Dark Tower'' series * ''[[Kà]]'', a Cirque du Soleil show * ''[[Mister Mosquito]]'', a video game, known in Japan as ''Ka'' ==Organisations== * [[Kappa Alpha Order]], a fraternity founded in 1865 at Washington and Lee University * [[Kappa Alpha Society]], a fraternity founded in 1825 at Union College * [[Kuklos Adelphon]], an 1800s-era Southern fraternity * [[Knattspyrnufélag Akureyrar]], an Icelandic football club * [[Karenni Army]], a Burmese guerilla organization ==Science and technology== * [[Ka band|K<sub>a</sub> band]], a microwave band * [[Kiloampere]], a unit of electrical current * K<sub>a</sub>, an [[acid dissociation constant]] * ka, [[kiloannum]], a unit of time * [[Keepalive]], a computer network message ==Places== * [[Ka River]], Nigeria * [[KA postcode area]], Scotland * [[List_of_short_place_names#Two-letter_place_names|Ka Farm]], [[Østre Toten]], Norway * [[Karlsruhe]], Germany * [[Karnataka]], India ==Transport== * [[Ford Ka]], a car * [[Kenya Airways]] * [[Dragonair]], an airline by IATA code ==Other uses== * [[Ka (pharaoh)]] (fl. c. 32nd century BCE) * [[Ka (Egyptian soul)]], ancient Egyptian concept of spirit or soul * [[KA (rapper)]], performer * [[Knight or Dame of St. Andrew (Barbados)]], a Barbadian award {{disambig}}
